replies.content: Christopher Joyce In my conversations with people building AI into critical processes, I am relieved to find the level of accountability, trust, and ethics they are applying to this integration.When things matter - when clients expect reliability -, it naturally constrains the use of technology.This also means either a) we get less AI than we thought or b) we get it everywhere at scale and with valueThe tendency and the things I am seeing looks more like b right now tbh. Carefully thought out AI setups that provide value and can be audited. Hence I believe we will see this everywhere. But there is still so much change management in the entire consumer game to be managed, and also in how it will be applied decentrally into more disparate processes. And we really need to think about how we add humans on top, and why they still matter even with AI doing the boring productivity work.
